title: AP Exam Review & Comprehensive Practice
description: Comprehensive spiral review across all AP Calculus AB content areas: limits & continuity, differentiation (definition, rules, composite/implicit), contextual and analytical applications of derivatives, integration & accumulation, differential equations, and applications of integration. Focus on synthesis, AP exam strategies, and timed practice under exam conditions.
goals: Synthesize derivative and integral concepts across all AP Calc AB units.
Develop fluency switching between MCQ and FRQ formats under timed conditions.
Identify and correct common errors: sign errors, missing chain rule, misapplied theorems.
Build confidence with calculator-active problems: numerical integration, graphical analysis.
instructionalStrategy: AI-led comprehensive review using diagnostic-driven focus areas
Mixed-topic problem sets to build fluency switching between concepts
Emphasis on multi-step FRQ problems requiring multiple skill integration
Timed mini-sections simulating AP exam pacing

scaffold.title: Review Block A: Limits, Continuity & Derivatives Foundations
scaffold.content: Review of limits (graphical, algebraic, at infinity), continuity, IVT/Squeeze, derivative definition, and basic differentiation rules. These form the foundation for all later topics.
keyPoints: Limits: direct substitution first. If 0/0: factor, rationalize, multiply conjugate, or use L'Hopital's Rule.
One-sided limits, infinite limits (VA), limits at infinity (HA). Compare degrees for rational functions.
Continuity at c: f(c) defined, lim exists, lim = f(c). Removable vs non-removable discontinuities.
IVT: if f continuous on [a,b] and k between f(a) and f(b), then f(c)=k for some c in (a,b).
Derivative definition: f'(x) = lim(h->0) [f(x+h)-f(x)]/h. Differentiability implies continuity (not converse).
Power/sum/product/quotient rules. Common derivatives: sin, cos, tan, sec, eˣ, ln x.

scaffold.title: Review Block A: Mixed Limits & Derivatives Problems

problems.problem: A function f is defined piecewise: f(x) = (x²-9)/(x-3) for x≠3, f(3) = k. Find k so f is continuous at x=3.
Using the limit definition, find f'(x) for f(x) = 1/(2x+1).

scaffold.title: Review Block B: Advanced Differentiation & Applications
scaffold.content: Review of chain rule, implicit differentiation, related rates, motion, linearization, MVT/EVT, extrema, concavity, curve sketching, and optimization.
keyPoints: Chain rule: d/dx[f(g(x))] = f'(g(x))·g'(x). Always look for composition!
Implicit: differentiate both sides with respect to x, collect dy/dx terms, solve.
Related rates: identify variables, relate with equation, differentiate with respect to t.
MVT: f'(c) = [f(b)-f(a)]/(b-a). f must be continuous on [a,b], differentiable on (a,b).
EVT: continuous on closed interval guarantees absolute max and min exist.
First derivative test: sign changes of f'. Second derivative test: f'(c)=0 and sign of f''(c).
Optimization: define objective, set up constraint, substitute, find critical points, verify extremum.

scaffold.title: Review Block B: Mixed Differentiation Applications

problems.problem: [FRQ-style] A particle moves along the x-axis with velocity v(t) = t² - 5t + 4 for t ≥ 0. (a) Find all times when the particle is at rest. (b) Determine when the particle moves left. (c) Find the acceleration at t = 3. (d) Is the particle speeding up or slowing down at t = 3?
problems.answer: (a) v(t)=0: t²-5t+4=(t-1)(t-4)=0 → t=1, t=4. (b) v(t)<0: (t-1)(t-4)<0 → 1<t<4, particle moves left. (c) a(t)=v'(t)=2t-5. a(3)=6-5=1. (d) At t=3: v(3)=9-15+4=-2<0 (left), a(3)=1>0. Velocity and acceleration have opposite signs → slowing down.

problems.problem: A 10-ft ladder leans against a vertical wall. The bottom slides away at 2 ft/s. How fast is the top sliding down when the bottom is 6 ft from the wall?
problems.answer: x² + y² = 100. 2x(dx/dt) + 2y(dy/dt) = 0. When x=6: y=√(100-36)=8. 2(6)(2) + 2(8)(dy/dt) = 0 → 24 + 16(dy/dt) = 0 → dy/dt = -3/2 ft/s. Top slides down at 3/2 ft/s.

problems.problem: Find the absolute maximum and minimum of f(x) = x³ - 3x² + 1 on [-1, 4].

scaffold.title: Review Block C: Integration, FTC & Differential Equations
scaffold.content: Review of Riemann sums, FTC Parts 1 and 2, antiderivatives, u-substitution, slope fields, separable DEs, and growth/decay.
keyPoints: Riemann sums: left, right, midpoint, trapezoidal. Over/underestimates depend on monotonicity/concavity.
FTC Part 1: d/dx[∫ₐˣ f(t)dt] = f(x). With chain rule: d/dx[∫ₐ^{g(x)} f(t)dt] = f(g(x))·g'(x).
FTC Part 2: ∫ₐᵇ f(x)dx = F(b) - F(a), where F' = f.
u-substitution: choose u = inner function, du = derivative, substitute, integrate, back-substitute.
Slope fields: at each point (x,y), draw short segment with slope = dy/dx.
Separable DEs: get all y terms with dy, all x terms with dx. Integrate both sides.
Exponential growth/decay: dy/dt = ky → y = y₀eᵏᵗ. k>0 growth, k<0 decay.

scaffold.title: Review Block C: Mixed Integration & DE Problems

problems.problem: Let g(x) = ∫₀ˣ f(t)dt where f is given by a graph: f(t) = 2 for 0≤t<2, f(t) = -(t-2) for 2≤t≤4. (a) Find g(2) and g(4). (b) Find g'(3). (c) Where does g have a maximum on [0,4]?
problems.answer: (a) g(2) = ∫₀² 2dt = 4. g(4) = g(2) + ∫₂⁴ -(t-2)dt = 4 + [-(t-2)²/2]₂⁴ = 4 + (-2-0) = 2. (b) g'(3) = f(3) = -(3-2) = -1. (c) g'(x) = f(x). f changes from positive to negative at x=2. g has maximum at x=2, g(2)=4.
Let u = x³, du = 3x²dx → x²dx = du/3. ∫ cos(u)·(du/3) = (1/3)sin(u) + C = (1/3)sin(x³) + C.
Separate: dy/y² = 2x dx. ∫ y⁻² dy = ∫ 2x dx → -1/y = x² + C. IC: -1/1 = 0 + C → C = -1. -1/y = x² - 1 → y = 1/(1-x²). Domain: |x| < 1.

scaffold.title: Review Block D: Applications of Integration
scaffold.content: Review of average value, motion via integrals, area between curves, and volumes of revolution. Common errors and AP exam pitfalls.
keyPoints: Average value: f_avg = (1/(b-a))∫ₐᵇ f(x)dx.
Displacement = ∫ₐᵇ v(t)dt. Total distance = ∫ₐᵇ |v(t)|dt.
Area between curves: ∫ₐᵇ |f(x)-g(x)|dx. Determine top/bottom (or right/left) function.
Disk method: V = π∫ₐᵇ [R(x)]² dx. Washer: V = π∫ₐᵇ ([R(x)]² - [r(x)]²) dx.
Common AP errors: forgetting absolute value in distance, wrong axis of revolution, forgetting π in volume.
Cross-section volumes: V = ∫ₐᵇ A(x)dx where A(x) is the cross-sectional area at x.

scaffold.title: Review Block D: Mixed Integration Applications

problems.problem: Find the area enclosed by y = x² and y = 2x + 3.
The region bounded by y = √x, y = 0, and x = 4 is revolved about the x-axis. Find the volume.
problems.answer: Disk method: V = π∫₀⁴ (√x)² dx = π∫₀⁴ x dx = π[x²/2]₀⁴ = π(8-0) = 8π.

problems.problem: A particle has velocity v(t) = sin(t) - cos(t) for 0 ≤ t ≤ 2π. Find (a) displacement and (b) total distance traveled.
problems.answer: (a) Displacement = ∫₀²π (sin t - cos t)dt = [-cos t - sin t]₀²π = (-1-0)-(-1-0) = 0. (b) v(t)=0: sin t = cos t → tan t = 1 → t = π/4, 5π/4. |∫₀^{π/4} (sint-cost)dt| + |∫_{π/4}^{5π/4} (sint-cost)dt| + |∫_{5π/4}^{2π} (sint-cost)dt| = |(-√2/2-√2/2)-(-1-0)| + ... = (1-√2) + (2√2) + (√2-1) = ... Total distance = 4√2.
